Comments
very safe. you must have an id to gain access to the building or a visitors' pass. security is on every floor.
there are greek honor societies you are able to join if eligibility is met.
plenty of clubs to join but not many athletics to join. (fashion club, photography club, international club, etc)
great for any student who is trying to learn and excel in life.
there are activity periods every wednesday which include games, karaoke, arts and crafts among other things.
no dining within the college. vending machines only but some neighboring restaurants offer student discounts.
no dorms at this specific berkeley but there is housing available along with several neighboring colleges

it honestly depends on the professor you have. i'm satisfied with each professor i've had and believed they taught me to the best of their knowledge. everything was thoroughly taught and academic support is available.
research, research, research! know the tuition and academic programs compared to other colleges before going with berkeley seeing that their academic year is in quarters and not semesters.
the professors are excellent by far and usually certified in their field. financially i think berkeley rips their students off. credits are also hard to transfer.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Meagan from Pine Plains, NY 06/01/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 36 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Berkeley is great for any student looking for a smaller, more intimate feeling where staff know you by name and remember you. It's great for those who would like the feel of a small city with the option of easily traveling to the Big City at any given moment. There are a lot of employment opportunities in the area so if you are a student looking to work during your college years, Berkeley is a good choice. Tips for prospective students Visit the school first and see how you feel. It is not a typical college campus because the city of White Plains IS the campus. Be prepared to make a few trips to the school prior to the start of term because there are a lot of things that get left to the last minute or come up after you
